newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Reed-Elsevier in strategic Microsoft deal.
newsitem.headline: Reed-Elsevier in strategic Microsoft deal.

text.p: Anglo-Dutch publishing group Reed-Elsevier said on Tuesday it had signed a letter of intent enabling it to use Microsoft products for its electronic information products and corporate platforms.
The five-year agreement is valued at $30 million, Reed-Elsevier said in a statement.

The deal will enable Reed-Elsevier to use Microsoft Commercial Internet Systems (MCIS), a suite of commercial-grade Internet applications for the future electronic distribution of its information products to customers, it said.
For Microsoft, the agreement is part of its strategy of forming key alliances in different industries.
Reed-Elsevier is to be Microsoft's key alliance partner in the scientific, professional and business publishing and information industry, the company said.
The strategic aspects of the relationship would be reflected in numerous cooperation projects over the five years, it said.

"We have chosen Microsoft as our key technology partner because we feel it is the company with the strongest expertise and resources to help us build the technology components needed for the overall success of Reed-Elsevier's strategies for electronic publishing," said Co-Chairman Nigel Stapleton.

"This is a tremendous opportunity for Microsoft to support one of the most significant companies of the information age," said Bill Gates, Microsoft Chairman and CEO. -- Amsterdam newsroom +31 20 504 5000, Fax +31 20 504 5040
